page.title: 14The Burgess Hill Clay Pits
page.content: The{Burgess Hill Clay Pits}are just off Kings Way. The pits provided clay for bricks and tiles. They are now waste-land and are used for fishing. The{Keymer Tile Company}want to fill them in with baled refuse. If they were filled in, the land could be sold for building or other uses. The residents don't want dumping of refuse because of rats, the smell of the rubbish, the danger of lorries to children and because it would look ugly. The{East Burgess Hill Residents' {Association}was formed to fight against the tipping and has persuaded the Council not to allow it. People are still wondering what will happen to the site. Some would like a{golf course}and others a{park,} as there is a lack of open space on the Folders Lane Estate.
